resources.string: What holds us together . In Brexit times we want to glimpse the European soul. This programme will illustrate the colourful variety of Europe, present different relationships between religion and politics. celebrate Universal Children s Day and outline future prospects for everyone.Loresn epsump ghtrg ghhjukk ghjjjjk gtff. Contact
Reformationsjubiläum 2017 e.V.
Neustr. 10 b
06886 Lutherstadt Wittenberg, Germany
This app will be launched in English.\n Sie können auf deutsch wechseln.

The open-air exhibition is called “Gates of Freedom” – to symbolise the way the Reformation pushed open various doors and brought new freedoms. Just as Martin Luther, in 1517, questioned the circumstances of his life and times, in 2017 we are discussing current issues: youth; spirituality; globalisation; ecumenism & religion; art & culture; justice, peace and integrity of creation. The topics are allocated to seven Gate areas. That is a guide not only to the themes but also to the layout on the ground. Installations have been designed for each gate by students from different universities in Germany and Austria. They invite us to make discoveries and reflect on them.

At the World Reformation Exhibition church and non-church groups alike from all denominations, civic institutions, groups and organizations, and cultural bodies and educational establishments from all over the world are invited. On big and little stages in the city, in tents, on panels, in cafés or bars, they create together an image of reformation ideas and ideas that encompass the entire world and takes on board a variety of inspirations. The exhibitors and local establishments in Wittenberg invite the visitors to take part in discussions, lectures, church services, concerts, plays and much more. Each of the 16 topic weeks brings together inspiring personalities, newcomer and well-known heads. Additionally, museums, churches and other permanent exhibitions in Wittenberg are part of the World Reformation Exhibition.

This is an official event during World Reformation Exhibition in Wittenberg. Hope to see you there! For further information check #Reformationssommer | r2017.org. Download the official app free of charge for iOS or Android at r2017.org/app - including an audio guide with Margot Käßmann, special envoy of the Council of the Evangelical Church in Germany for the Reformation anniversary in 2017.
